com.opengamma.strata.collect.id

Interface LinkResolver


  • public interface LinkResolver
    A resolver that can provide the target when resolving links.

    A Link provides loose coupling between different parts of the object model. When the target of a link is needed, it is resolved by passing in a link resolver.

    Link resolution will typically be implemented to access an underlying data store. If the link specifies an identifier that is not resolvable, or the declared target type is incorrect, an exception is thrown.

    • Method Detail

      • none

        static LinkResolver none()
        Obtains a link resolver that is unable to resolve any links.

        This is a special implementation of LinkResolver that will be used when it is assumed that all targets have already been resolved. Any attempt to resolve a link will throw LinkResolutionException

        Returns:
        the link resolver

      • resolve

        default <T extends IdentifiableBean> T resolve(StandardId identifier,
                                               Class<T> targetType)
        Resolves the supplied link, returning the realized target of the link.

        The implementation of this interface may perform any thread-safe action to obtain the link target. Typically this will involve accessing an underlying data store. If the link cannot be resolved then a LinkResolutionException will be thrown.

        The type is expressed as a standard Class object.

        Type Parameters:
        T - the type of the target of the link
        Parameters:
        identifier - the identifier to be resolved
        targetType - the target type of the link
        Returns:
        the resolved target of the link
        Throws:
        LinkResolutionException - if the link cannot be resolved

      • resolve

        <T extends IdentifiableBean> T resolve(StandardId identifier,
                                       TypeToken<T> targetType)
        Resolves the supplied link, returning the realized target of the link.

        The implementation of this interface may perform any thread-safe action to obtain the link target. Typically this will involve accessing an underlying data store. If the link cannot be resolved then a LinkResolutionException will be thrown.

        The type is expressed as a TypeToken, which allows types like Trade<Swap> to be expressed: 

          new TypeToken<Trade<Swap>>() {};
        Type Parameters:
        T - the type of the target of the link
        Parameters:
        identifier - the identifier to be resolved
        targetType - the target type of the link
        Returns:
        the resolved target of the link
        Throws:
        LinkResolutionException - if the link cannot be resolved

      • resolveLinksIn

        default <B> B resolveLinksIn(B bean)
        Resolves all the links within the specified bean.

        This takes the specified bean and resolves any links if the object implements Resolvable. If the target is not resolvable, or the target is already resolved, then the specified input bean will be returned.

        This method is primarily useful where the type of the input object is not known to be resolvable. For example, this might occur when processing a List<Object>.

        Parameters:
        bean - the target bean
        Returns:
        the resolved bean

      • resolveLinksIn

        default <B,T> B resolveLinksIn(B bean,
                               T target,
                               Function<T,B> updateFn)
        Resolves all the links within one property of a bean.

        This takes the specified bean and replaces the target object. The target must be a property of the bean and the update function must be able to replace the target. The update must return a new bean, leaving the original unaltered.

        If the target is not resolvable, is null, or is already resolved, then the specified input bean will be returned.

        For example, this method might be used as follows: 

          resolver.resolveLinksIn(bean, bean.getFoo(), resolved -> bean.toBuilder().foo(resolved).build());

        This method is typically invoked from implementations of Resolvable.resolveLinks(LinkResolver). In that case, the above example would use this instead of bean.

        Parameters:
        bean - the target bean
        target - the target object within the bean, may be null
        updateFn - the update function
        Returns:
        the updated bean
